title: configuration via autoconfig.php fails in owncloud 4.0.7 w/sqlite
body:
transferred from bug genie.
http://bugs.owncloud.org/thebuggenie/owncloud/issues/oc-1519

repeatable with daily build on dec 11, 2012

description:
headless setup of owncloud instances via autoconfig.php fails due to a fatal error in the sqlite3 adapter. when creating an autoconfig.php (see below) and executing index.php, a fatal error is logged: php fatal error: call to a member function lasterrormsg() on a non-object in /var/www/lib/mdb2/driver/sqlite3.php on line 102 autoconfig.php is unlink()ed successfully, and a config.php is created - however, database creation and population fails, rendering the installation unsuccessfull. after reloading index.php, $_post is no longer autopopulated by setup.php and the standard installation screen is displayed.

i checked line 102 in sqlite3.php and it says $native_msg = $this->_lasterror

       ? html_entity_decode($this->_lasterror) : $this->connection->lasterrormsg();

i haven't dug into this very deep, but i presume neither $this->_lasterror nor $this->connection exist and the ternary is therefore false + the fallthrough method is nonexistant.

i commented out the ternary line 102 and replaced it by a simple

     $native_msg = html_entity_decode($this->_lasterror);

after this, autosetup runs flawlessly.

icon_edit.png reproduction steps:
i have created an autoconfig.php file with the following content on my test machine:

<?php $autoconfig = array(

'installed' => false,
'adminlogin' => 'admin',
'adminpass' => 'changeme',
'directory' => '/var/www/data',
'dbtype' => 'sqlite',
'dbname' => 'owncloud.db',
'dbtableprefix' => 'oc_',
);

?>
